Day 4 of Our Alaskan Cruise- Seeing the Hubbard Glacier ( Don't forget to click on a picture to see a larger version of it)

Obie and Johnnie are glad weather is clearing up
Watching from the bow of the ship off the gym
Shots around the bay containing the Hubbard Glacier

The Hubbard Glacier, blue ridge in distance, starts 76 miles away on Mt. Logan in Canada
It is the largest North America tidewater glacier.
It terminates in Disenchantment Bay/Russell Fiord near Yakutat, SE Alaska

Hubbard Glacier is the blue glacier on right
This is so awe inspring!
The glacier is 6 miles wide in the bay,
